articles.title: Immediate Withdrawal of S. Korean Troops from Iraq Urged
Kim Jong Il Hailed as Great Strategist
articles.content:
Immediate Withdrawal of S. Korean Troops from Iraq Urged 
   Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Members of civic and public organizations in south Korea reportedly held an anti-war rally in Seoul on Dec. 16 at which they denounced the "government's" attempt at the long-term presence of the Jaitun unit in Iraq.
 They warned that if the "government" seeks the long-term presence of the unit instead of its withdrawal, that will touch off stronger protest from the people, vowing to carry on the struggle for the immediate withdrawal of the unit.    
 At the end of the rally the participants staged a demonstration.

articles.title: New Tree Growing Stations Appear in DPRK
Many Poems and Songs See Light This Year
articles.content:
New Tree Growing Stations Appear in DPRK 
   Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Evodia Daniellii Benn tree growing stations have been set up in more than 130 cities and counties of the DPRK.
 Evodia Daniellii Benn forests extending 10,000 hectares or more have been additionally created in the provinces, cities and counties this year to help resolve the problem of edible oil.    
 With the expansion of the forests, stations for growing them have been set up in cities and counties, which have launched into an energetic work to consolidate their material and technical foundations.

New Feature Film Produced
Strict Observance of Socialist Law Called for
articles.content:
New Feature Film Produced 
   Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- The April 25 Film Studio of the Korean People's Army produced new feature film "Photo Left by Him" recently.
 The film is based on the true story about DPRK Hero Kim Ki Bong who was an officer of the KPA. He dedicated his life to saving comrades. He truly treasured and loved his soldiers, taking the revolutionary comradeship shown by Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il as the maxim of his life.    
 The film shows its hero breathing his last before keeping the promise he had made with his family to have a picture taken together. But servicepersons of the unit pose for a photograph together with the members of the family of the departed hero on the day when his daughter was leaving for a revolutionary school. These touching scenes of the film show that though the hero's physical life is over, he is immortal as he will be always remembered by the country and the people.

articles.title: Wreath Laid before Bust of Kim Jong Suk
Foreign Diplomats Visit Three-Revolution Exhibition
articles.content:
Wreath Laid before Bust of Kim Jong Suk 
   Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- The Military Attaches Corps here laid a wreath before the bust of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero, at the Revolutionary Martyrs' Cemetery on Mt. Taesong on Thursday to mark her 89th birth anniversary.
 Written on the ribbon of the wreath were letters reading "The revolutionary exploits of anti-Japanese war hero Comrade Kim Jong Suk are immortal!"

S. Korean Delegation Arrives Here
   Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the South Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration headed by Chairman Paek Rak Chong arrived here today.
 It was greeted at the airport by An Kyong Ho, chairman of the North Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, and officials concerned.
